detaileddescription.para: Initialize a class from the Smalltalk-side
Create a new process, a new context and send the initialize message to the class. The process is executed in blocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: the class to be initialized

detaileddescription.para: Resize SyxObject::data to the given size, being careful of object indexables and byte indexables.
Warning, if the new size is lesser than the current, the data at the end of the array will be lost
Creates a new metaclass.
The metaclass will be an instance of the Metaclass class. Instance size is inherited by superclass

parameterdescription.para: the superclass of the new metaclass

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new class.
This function automatically creates the metaclass for the new class with syx_metaclass_new. The new class is an instance of the metaclass.

parameterdescription.para: the superclass of the new class

detaileddescription.para: Create a new LargeInteger.
This function is available only if Syx has been linked with the GMP library

parameterdescription.para: a textual representation of the number
the radix of the representation

detaileddescription.para: Create a new LargeInteger with the given mpz
Transform a 32-bit integer to a multiple precision integer.
This function is available only if Syx has been linked with the GMP library
Create a new suspended Process and schedule it.

parameterdescription.para: a MethodContext or BlockContext

detaileddescription.para: Remove an element from an Array.

simplesect.para: TRUE if element was found and removed, else FALSE

detaileddescription.para: Add an element to an Array.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if the element shouldn't be added if already present in the array

detaileddescription.para: Returns a Symbol instance.

Lookups into syx_symbols dictionary to check the existance of the symbol, otherwise create a new one and insert it into the dictionary.
symbol
a plain constant string
Returns the hash of a String

memberdef.argsstring: (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key, syx_int32 hash, syx_bool return_nil_index)
memberdef.name: syx_dictionary_index_of

detaileddescription.para: Returns the index of the given symbol, the index of an empty entry or -1 if the key was not found.
Take care the dictionary MUST contain only key symbols

parameterdescription.para: the hash code of the key symbol
if TRUE returns the index of the first nil entry

detaileddescription.para: Create an association key -> index to be used as binding. Raise an error if not found.
Take care the dictionary MUST contain only key symbols
Create an association key -> index to be used as binding. Return the given object if not found.
Take care the dictionary MUST contain only symbol keys
Binds a VariableBinding returned by syx_dictionary_binding_at_symbol. Raise an exception if not bound.

The function get the dictionary entry at the index (the value of the given association) then compare the two keys. If they're equal, then return the value of the dictionary entry; if not, lookup the key and change the the index of the binding.
Binds a VariableBinding returned by syx_dictionary_binding_at_symbol. Return the given object if not found.

The function get the dictionary entry at the index (the value of the given association) then compare the two keys. If they're equal, then return the value of the dictionary entry; if not, lookup the key and change the the index of the binding.
Set the object value of the binding returned by syx_dictionary_binding_at_symbol. Raise an exception if not found.
The function does the same thing ot syx_dictionary_bind, except that it sets the value in the Dictionary entry
Lookup a key by symbol in the dictionary. Raise an error if not found.
Take care the dictionary MUST contain only symbol keys
Lookup a key by symbol in the dictionary. Return the given object if not found.
Take care the dictionary MUST contain only key symbols
Grow the dictionary and rehash all data
Insert key -> value in the dictionary
Create a new MethodContext.

parameterdescription.para: a CompiledMethod
an Object receiving the message
the arguments passed to the message

detaileddescription.para: Same as syx_method_context_new but for BlockContexts. The receiver is guessed by looking at the outer context.

parameterdescription.para: a BlockClosure

detaileddescription.para: Create a new object specifying an arbitrary number of instance variables.

parameterdescription.para: the class of the new instance
number of instance variables the instance must hold

detaileddescription.para: Create a new object of the given size.

parameterdescription.para: specify if the created object must be Object indexable or Byte indexable
number of objects/bytes to hold

memberdef.argsstring: (SyxOop klass, syx_bool has_refs, syx_varsize size, SyxOop *data)
memberdef.name: syx_object_new_data

detaileddescription.para: Create a new object of the given size with the given data.

parameterdescription.para: specify if the created object must be Object indexable or Byte indexable
number of objects/bytes to hold
the data of the object (must be an array of SyxOop or syx_int8)

detaileddescription.para: Make a shallow copy of an object
Frees all the memory used by the object.
If the class has finalizationRequest set to true, perform finalize on the object
Check if a class is a superclass of another one.

parameterdescription.para: a class
a class that should be a subclass of the former

simplesect.para: TRUE if the first is a superclass of the second

detaileddescription.para: Get a list of all instance variable names defined in a class.
The returned list is ordered to be used by the interpreter to access the variables directly using the list index.

simplesect.para: A syx_symbol list or NULL. The list must be freed once unused

detaileddescription.para: Returns a method in a class having the given selector.

simplesect.para: syx_nil if no method has been found

detaileddescription.para: A mix between syx_class_lookup_method and syx_dictionary_bind_if_absent.

simplesect.para: syx_nil if no method has been found

detaileddescription.para: Send a signal to a Semaphore to wake up waiting processes.
The function is thread-safe
Put the active process in waiting state until semaphore is signaled.
The function is thread-safe
